snippet: The scale and brutality of the attack on supporters of the ousted president, Mohamed Morsi, was the clearest sign yet that the old Egyptian police state was re-emerging in full force.
abstract: Egyptian security officers storm two encampments packed with supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi in scorched-earth attack that kills hundreds; sets off violent backlash across Egypt and underscores new government's determination to crush Islamists who dominated two years of free elections; scale and brutality of attack is clearest sign yet that old Egyptian police state is re-emerging in full force.
lead_paragraph: The scale and brutality of the attack on supporters of the ousted president, Mohamed Morsi, was the clearest sign yet that the old Egyptian police state was re-emerging in full force.

headline.sub: Emergency Declared as Sectarian Attacks Spread in Country
headline.main: Hundreds Die as Egyptian Forces Attack Islamist Protesters
headline.print_headline: Hundreds of Egyptians Killed In Government Raids; Emergency Declared As Sectarian Violence Spreads

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
